RelatedSentence: Time Magazine 's recent cover story calls attention to the ongoing sexual assault issues at college campuses across the nation .
The story also highlights the steps the City of Missoula and the University of Montana have taken in recent years .
The story also highlights the steps the City of Missoula and the University of Montana have taken in recent years .
The college town of Missoula , Montana saw at least 80 reported rapes over three years , earning it the name ' America 's Rape Capital .
The college town of Missoula , Montana saw at least 80 reported rapes over three years , earning it the name ' America 's Rape Capital .
' But the nickname has it wrong .
That 's how the article by Eliza Gray starts , as it readdresses an issue that started for Missoula and UM just over two years ago .

May 1 , 2012 , the Department of Justice came to town to announce an investigation into the Missoula Police Department , the Missoula County Attorney 's Office and the University of Montana 's handling of reported sexual assault cases .
But as the article points out , that has n't stopped Missoula from working on improvements -- everything from training , to tracking , to educating .
But as the article points out , that has n't stopped Missoula from working on improvements -- everything from training , to tracking , to educating .
So rather than focus on Missoula as an outrageous oddity , it is more productive to see it as a starting point for fixing a shameful situation , Gray writes .
As the Obama administration takes a tougher approach on the tough issue .

Last month the Department of Education released a list of 55 schools with possible Title IX violations , and senators from New York , Missouri and Connecticut have vowed to come up with ideas for a campus - assaults bill .
